author: DistroTube
description:
'uptime' tells you how long the system has been running.

- Print current time, uptime, number of users logged on, and load averages:
uptime

- Print uptime in "pretty" format (shows only the uptime):
uptime -p

- Print the system up "since" time (time since system booted up):
uptime -s

- Print values in "raw" format (current time and uptime displayed in seconds).
uptime -r

- Print the container uptime instead of system uptime.
uptime -c

title: 'uptime' - print system uptime - Video Man Pages
